channel.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
channel.description:
Was just wondering, is it normal that a simple model scene like this, takes around 30 minutes to render? Using 3ds max, default renderer, and a skylight.
All of these, took 15 mins+ to render each, the one with the simple door, was 33 minutes exactly.
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Door.png[/img]
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/01-7.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/001-FurnitureHQ.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/01-Lounge.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/KatanainSkylight.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/08-HighQualityRealismSkylight.png[/img]

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I once cried because my Microsoft Office 2007 trial ran out and I had a big powerpoint presentation and speech due in the next day and I didn’t even know what a torrent was, or a serial.

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:302162”]That’s awesome Frell, why can’t I be as good as you?

I can’t even create a decent metal material, haha.[/quote]
Its taken me a good 2-3 years to get decent, don’t worry. You’re technically still new to MAX though

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:302162”]So if I was to model a replica of my dining room, you would recommend Vray?

And yeah, i mostly do sort of tables, chairs, general furniture etc, have done a few guitars though.[/quote]
Vray would work for a dining room, yes. I can’t stand vray because even though its almost impossible to have something look 100%, i still hate my renders if they dont look awesome, Even if everyone i know will disagree =\

Like this: http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/9533/monolisa.png (Not going to [ img] so i don’t steal topic :P) it sucks penis hole to me

Read full topic

And yeah, i mostly do sort of tables, chairs, general furniture etc, have done a few guitars though.

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Depends what kind of stuff you want to render.

Vray is beast for architectural stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:4, topic:302162”]Skylight will do that, especially on the default renderer.

By default do you mean the Mental Ray that comes with it, or the built in scanline?

Although, I’ve done a lot quicker renders with GI and blurry reflections on my laptop:

2 GHz dual core, 4 GB RAM, laptop also.[/quote]

I meant the built in scanline.

Can you recommend any other renderers that are worth downloading?
I tried vray, but the program would not detect the plugin no matter what i did, so, yeah.
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Skylight will do that, especially on the default renderer.

By default do you mean the Mental Ray that comes with it, or the built in scanline?

Although, I’ve done a lot quicker renders with GI and blurry reflections on my laptop:

2 GHz dual core, 4 GB RAM, laptop also.

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question About Rendering Times

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

2.0gHz intel duo processor.
3gb RAM.
358mb mobile intel graphics card.

All on my laptop.
